intro: Gymnanthemum vidalii, commonly known as the Vidal's gymnanthemum, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
